meanings.definition: A pointed stake or post driven into the ground to form a fence.
meanings.sent1: The farmer used a picket to mark the boundary of his land.
meanings.sent2: The wooden picket fence surrounded the garden beautifully.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel balanced on the picket, pretending it was a tightrope.
meanings.sent4: Her determination was like a picket, firmly holding her beliefs in place.
meanings.sent5: The picket stood tall, guarding the flowers from any harm.

meanings.definition: A person or group of people stationed outside a workplace or other location as part of a strike or protest.
meanings.sent1: The picket outside the factory chanted slogans for fair wages.
meanings.sent2: The picket peacefully demonstrated for better working conditions.
meanings.sent3: The picket shared jokes to keep spirits high during the protest.
meanings.sent4: Their unity on the picket line was a powerful symbol of solidarity.
meanings.sent5: The picket's determination inspired others to join the cause.

meanings.definition: To stand or march outside a location as part of a strike or protest.
meanings.sent1: They decided to picket in front of the city hall to demand change.
meanings.sent2: The workers picketed peacefully, holding signs for their rights.
meanings.sent3: The students picketed in a circle, singing songs of unity.
meanings.sent4: Her heart picketed against the unfair treatment of animals.
meanings.sent5: The community picketed together, raising their voices for justice.

meanings.definition: To fasten or decorate with pickets.
meanings.sent1: She wanted to picket the garden gate with colorful ribbons.
meanings.sent2: The children picketed the treehouse with handmade signs.
meanings.sent3: The artist picketed the canvas with bold strokes of paint.
meanings.sent4: His love for her was picketed with memories of their adventures.
meanings.sent5: The house was picketed with twinkling lights for the festive season.
